member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.Ink.UltraInkProviderEventManager.IsEnabled(Infragistics.Win.Ink.UltraInkProviderEventIds)
member.summary: Returns true if the event is enabled
member.param: The id of the event.
member.returns: true if the event is enabled; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.Ink.UltraInkProviderEventManager.SetEnabled(Infragistics.Win.Ink.UltraInkProviderEventIds,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables/Disables a specific event.
member.param: Enumerator specifying the event to enabled/disable.
Boolean specifying whether the event is enabled (true) or disabled (false).

remarks.p: Disabling an event will not affect the internal operation of the control. Disabling simply instructs the control not to call the event handler so that code the programmer entered is not fired.
For example, disabling the CLick will not stop the control from changing the Active Node when it is clicked. It will only cause the Click Event not to fire when the control is clicked.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.Ink.UltraInkProviderEventManager.IsEnabled(Infragistics.Win.Ink.UltraInkProviderEventGroups)
member.summary: Returns true if all events in the group are enabled
member.param: The id of the events.
member.returns: true if the event group is enabled; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.Ink.UltraInkProviderEventManager.SetEnabled(Infragistics.Win.Ink.UltraInkProviderEventGroups,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables/Disables all events in the group.
member.param: Enumerator specifying the group of events to enabled/disabled.
Boolean specifying whether the events are enabled (true) or disabled (false).

remarks.p: Disabling an event will not affect the internal operation of the control. Disabling simply instructs the control not to call the event handler so that code the programmer entered is not fired.
For example, disabling the Click will not stop the control from changing the Active Node when it is clicked. It will only cause the Click Event not to fire when the control is clicked.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.Ink.UltraInkProvider.ActiveMaskCharacterAppearance
member.summary: Returns or sets the object that controls the formatting of the active mask character. Used only when editing text from masked editors using boxed input.

remarks.p: The Appearance property of an object is used to associate the object with an Appearance object that will determine its appearance. The Appearance object has properties that control settings such as color, borders, font, transparency, etc. For many of the objects in UltraWinToolbars, you do not set formatting properties directly. Instead, you set the properties of an Appearance object, which controls the formatting of the object it is attached to.

Note that the properties of an Appearance object can also operate in a hierarchical fashion. Certain properties can be set to a "use default" value, which indicates to the control that the property should take its setting from the object's parent. This functionality is enabled by default, so that unless you specify otherwise, child objects resemble their parents, and formatting set at higher levels of the control hierarchy is inherited by objects lower in the hierarchy.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.Ink.UltraInkProvider.HasActiveMaskCharacterAppearance
member.summary: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether an object has been created.

remarks.p: Returns True when the Appearance object for the property has been created; otherwise, returns False.
Use this property to determine whether an object has been created. Appearance objects in general are not created until the properties associated with them are accessed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.Ink.UltraInkProvider.EventManager
member.summary: The object that enables, disables and controls firing of specific component events.

remarks.p: The EventManager provides a high degree of control over how the control invokes event procedures. You can use it to selectively enable and disable event procedures depending on the context of your application. You can also use the event manager to return information about the state of the control's events.

The event manager's methods are used to determine the enabled state of an event (), to selectively enable or disable events (), and to determine whether an event procedure is currently being processed ().

Use this property to determine whether an object has been created. Appearance objects in general are not created until the properties associated with them are accessed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.Ink.UltraInkProvider.InputMode
member.summary: Returns/sets an enumeration that determines the input mode (Ink or Keyboard) of the UltraPenInputPanel

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.Ink.UltraInkProvider.InputModeSelectable
member.summary: Returns/sets whether the input mode (Ink or Keyboard) can be selected by the user via buttons on the UltraPenInputPanel.

remarks.p: If set to true, buttons are displayed on the UltrPenInputPanel to allow the end user to change the InputMode. If false, not buttons are dislayed and the end user cannot change the InputMode.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.Ink.UltraInkProvider.InvalidMaskCharacterAppearance
member.summary: Returns or sets the object that controls the formatting of characters whose text does not conform to the editor's mask. Used only when editing text from masked editors using boxed input.

remarks.p: The Appearance property of an object is used to associate the object with an Appearance object that will determine its appearance. The Appearance object has properties that control settings such as color, borders, font, transparency, etc. For many of the objects in UltraWinToolbars, you do not set formatting properties directly. Instead, you set the properties of an Appearance object, which controls the formatting of the object it is attached to.

Note that the properties of an Appearance object can also operate in a hierarchical fashion. Certain properties can be set to a "use default" value, which indicates to the control that the property should take its setting from the object's parent. This functionality is enabled by default, so that unless you specify otherwise, child objects resemble their parents, and formatting set at higher levels of the control hierarchy is inherited by objects lower in the hierarchy.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.Ink.UltraInkProvider.HasInvalidMaskCharacterAppearance

remarks.p: Returns True when the Appearance object for the property has been created; otherwise, returns False.
Use this property to determine whether an object has been created. Appearance objects in general are not created until the properties associated with them are accessed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.Ink.UltraInkProvider.IsInkRecognitionAvailable
member.summary: Returns true if Recognizers are installed on the system and available. Otherwise, returns false.

remarks.p: If recognizers are not available, the UltraPenInputPanel displays 'Ink Recognition NotAvailable' in the ink area and 'Gestures N/A' in the GesturePanel (if visible).

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.Ink.UltraPenInputPanel.ActiveMaskCharacterAppearance
member.summary: Returns or sets the object that controls the formatting of the active mask character. Used only when editing text from masked editors using boxed input.

remarks.p: The Appearance property of an object is used to associate the object with an Appearance object that will determine its appearance. The Appearance object has properties that control settings such as color, borders, font, transparency, etc. For many of the objects in UltraWinToolbars, you do not set formatting properties directly. Instead, you set the properties of an Appearance object, which controls the formatting of the object it is attached to.

Note that the properties of an Appearance object can also operate in a hierarchical fashion. Certain properties can be set to a "use default" value, which indicates to the control that the property should take its setting from the object's parent. This functionality is enabled by default, so that unless you specify otherwise, child objects resemble their parents, and formatting set at higher levels of the control hierarchy is inherited by objects lower in the hierarchy.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.Ink.UltraPenInputPanel.HasActiveMaskCharacterAppearance
member.summary: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether an object has been created.

remarks.p: Returns True when the Appearance object for the property has been created; otherwise, returns False.
Use this property to determine whether an object has been created. Appearance objects in general are not created until the properties associated with them are accessed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.Ink.UltraPenInputPanel.Appearance
member.summary: Returns or sets the object that controls the object's formatting.

remarks.p: The Appearance property of an object is used to associate the object with an Appearance object that will determine its appearance. The Appearance object has properties that control settings such as color, borders, font, transparency, etc. For many of the objects in UltraWinToolbars, you do not set formatting properties directly. Instead, you set the properties of an Appearance object, which controls the formatting of the object it is attached to.

Note that the properties of an Appearance object can also operate in a hierarchical fashion. Certain properties can be set to a "use default" value, which indicates to the control that the property should take its setting from the object's parent. This functionality is enabled by default, so that unless you specify otherwise, child objects resemble their parents, and formatting set at higher levels of the control hierarchy is inherited by objects lower in the hierarchy.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.Ink.UltraPenInputPanel.InputModeSelectable
member.summary: Returns/sets whether the input mode (Ink or Keyboard) can be selected by the user via buttons on the UltraPenInputPanel.

remarks.p: If set to true, buttons are displayed on the UltrPenInputPanel to allow the end user to change the InputMode. If false, not buttons are dislayed and the end user cannot change the InputMode.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.Ink.UltraPenInputPanelInternal
member.summary: UltraPenInputPanelInternal is an internal class derived from abstract base class UltraPenInputPanelBase. It is used by the UltraInkProvider to provide pen editing servives and is displayed in a popup window. It does not expose its key properties publicly. It calls off to the UltraInkProvider to provide values for its key properties (e.g., Appearance, InputMode etc.)
